> I think I have explained this multiple times. The Simple way, remove your Container plugin(Tomcat/Undertow), because you are using async mode between container and SpringMVC.

> @hanahmily Does `So11Receiver` collect metrics from its own OAP metrics? Look like that way. Also, you still keep Prometheus port open, right?

Exactly. `So11Telemtry` provides an API to supply metrics and still listen on Prometheus port.
@wu-sheng Fixed by https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/3145
Is this still in WIP status?

I am not a hession user, too. But `org.springframework.remoting.caucho.HessianServiceExporter` looks like not right indeed. @wayilau Why do you need to choose a Spring framework class? For most Spring components, they are just bridges, a hession-core level instrumentation should be enough. But if there is an exception, please make it clear to us.

Basically, I think @kezhenxu94 get the point, it should work w/ and w/o Spring both like other plugins did.

I think this feature implement should be:
1.seperate the `agent-core.jar` and `agent.jar`.
2.make the `agent-core.jar` loaded by bootstrap classloader ( cause the `agent-core.jar ` should be loaded by bootstrap classloader and `agent.jar` should be loaded by application classloader.).
3.Initialize the `Agent` by relfection in application classloader.
4.write some plugin to test

I am trying to implement the first version.

POC is still underway. Welcome to join.

I have successfully added the dynamic field, but due to classloader issue(AppClassLoader and BootstrapClassLoader both loaded it), it can't be used in the interceptor, causing cast exception `Can't cast EnhancedInstance to EnhancedInstance. But still could use refactor to use if it is necessary, sometimes, I assume yes.
OK.
@candyleer Even separate the jar(s), you still have the classloader issue to fix, because you need to access the same `TracingContext` and `ContextManager` :)
/run e2e
@wu-sheng Yes, it still has a bug: When the server stream service has en error, it will be eat exception and the span will be success.

> Yes, it still has a bug: When the server stream service has en error, it will be eat exception and the span will be success.

Try `ContextManager#awaitFinishAsync` and hold the span ref, you could tag and finish it in another thread. That API did exist when gRPC plugin built.

> I shoud add an instrumentation for HessianServlet ? am i right ? @kezhenxu94
> In springboot it doesn't use HessianServlet, it just uses HessianServiceExporter. so I give two instrumentation, it is enough?

Spring doesn't use `HessianServlet` indeed, but it uses `HessianSkeleton` (`org.springframework.remoting.caucho.HessianExporter#doInvoke`), `HessianServlet` also uses `HessianSkeleton` (`com.caucho.hessian.server.HessianServlet#invoke`), and it seems that you have already instrumented `HessianSkeleton`, so perhaps you can instrument `HessianSkeleton` and use SkyWalking dynamic field (or something similar) to keep the url (if any) in one request through the instrumented classes.

To summarize, I think class `HessianSkeleton` is the core of hessian, which should be used by any other frameworks that integrate with hessian, such as Spring, and instrumenting it should work with/wihout third-party frameworks

You do the tests quickly :) Thanks. 
To your question, from my understanding, when bootstrap instrumentation actived, EnhancedInstance should only be loaded in Bootstrap classloader. Otherwise, you will face `Class Cast Exception`, because you can't cat Bootstrap's EnhancedInstance to ApplicationClassLoader's EnhancedInstance.

Load the generated class to class loader w/o initialization should be safe. That is why I use `#injectRaw` rather than `#inject`.

This is my guess and understanding from test results, I used to try `#inject`, which cause that cast exception. :)
